The default value of this property is 'false'. This means, the Language service logs your input text for 48 hours, solely to allow for troubleshooting issues. Setting this property to true, disables input logging and may limit our ability to investigate issues that occur.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment
member.summary:
Contains the predicted sentiment, confidence scores, and other information related to Opinion Mining analysis.
For example, in the sentence "The food is good", the assessment of the target 'food' is 'good'.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.Sentiment
member.summary: Gets the predicted Sentiment for the assessment taking into account the value of . Possible values include 'positive', 'mixed', and 'negative'.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.ConfidenceScores
member.summary: Gets the sentiment confidence score (Softmax score) between 0 and 1, for the assessment for 'positive' and 'negative' labels. Its score for 'neutral' will always be 0. Higher values signify higher confidence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.Text
member.summary: Gets the assessment text.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.IsNegated
member.summary:
Whether the assessment is negated.
For example, in "The food is not good", the assessment "good" is negated.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.Offset
member.summary: Gets the starting position for the assessment text.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.AssessmentSentiment.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the assessment text.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity
member.summary: A word or phrase identified as an entity that can be categorized as known type in a given taxonomy. The set of categories recognized by the Language service is described at .

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.Text
member.summary: Gets the entity text as it appears in the input document.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.Category
member.summary: Gets the entity category inferred by the Language service's named entity recognition model. The list of available categories is described at .

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.SubCategory
member.summary: Gets the subcategory of the entity inferred by the Language service's named entity recognition model. This property may not have a value if a subcategory doesn't exist for this entity. The list of available categories and subcategories is described at .

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.ConfidenceScore
member.summary: Gets a score between 0 and 1, indicating the confidence that the text substring matches this inferred entity.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.Offset
member.summary: Gets the starting position for the matching text in the input document.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.CategorizedEntity.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the matching text in the input document.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.ClassificationCategory
member.summary: A classification of an input document extracted by the Single Label Classification operation. The service attributes a confidence score to the predicted category for measuring how confident the model is in the returned prediction.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.ClassificationCategory.Category
member.summary: Gets the predicted category for the respective document. The possible values of the category string depends on the custom categories set in the Text Analytics service for the targeted project.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.ClassificationCategory.ConfidenceScore
member.summary: Gets the confidence score of the predictive category. This is a value between 0 and 1 that represents the model's confidence in the predicted class, which can be used as an indicator of the probability of correctness.

The default value of this property is 'false'. This means, the Language service logs your input text for 48 hours, solely to allow for troubleshooting issues. Setting this property to true, disables input logging and may limit our ability to investigate issues that occur.
Please see Cognitive Services Compliance and Privacy notes at for additional details, and Microsoft Responsible AI principles at .

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity
member.summary: The LinkedEntity.

A word or phrase identified as a known entity in a data source. A link to the entry in the data source is provided as well as the formal name of the entity used in the data source. Note that the formal name may be different from the exact text match in the input document.

member.summary: Gets the formal name of the entity.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity.DataSourceEntityId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the entity in the data source.

member.summary: Gets the language used in the data source.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity.DataSource
member.summary: Gets the name of the data source used to extract the entity linking.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL that identifies the linked entity's entry in the data source.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity.Matches
member.summary: Collection identifying the substrings of the document that correspond to this linked entity.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntity.BingEntitySearchApiId
member.summary: Bing Entity Search API unique identifier of the recognized entity. Use in conjunction with the Bing Entity Search API to fetch additional relevant information.
member.remarks: This property only applies for , , and newer.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntityMatch
member.summary: The Match.
Details regarding the specific substring in the document matching the linked entity, or well-known item, that the Text Analytics model identified.

member.summary: Gets the entity text as it appears in the document.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.LinkedEntityMatch.ConfidenceScore
member.summary: Gets a score between 0 and 1, indicating the confidence that this substring matches the corresponding linked entity.

member.summary: Gets the starting position for the matching text in the document.

member.summary: Gets the length of the matching text in the sentence.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentBatchStatistics
member.summary: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the request payload.

A collection of statistics describing the batch of documents submitted to the service for analysis in a given request. This information is provided on the result collection returned by an operation when the caller passes in a with IncludeStatistics set to true.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentBatchStatistics.DocumentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of documents submitted in the request batch.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentBatchStatistics.ValidDocumentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of valid documents submitted in the request batch. This number excludes empty documents, documents whose size exceeds the service's size limit, and documents in unsupported languages.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentBatchStatistics.InvalidDocumentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of invalid documents submitted in the request batch. This number includes empty documents, documents whose size exceeds the service's size limit, and documents in unsupported languages.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentBatchStatistics.TransactionCount
member.summary: Gets the number of transactions required to complete the operation on all documents submitted in the request batch.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentStatistics
member.summary: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

A collection of statistics describing an individual input document. This information is provided on the result collection returned by an operation when the caller passes in a with IncludeStatistics set to true.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentStatistics.CharacterCount
member.summary: Gets the number of characters (in Unicode graphemes) the corresponding document contains.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentStatistics.TransactionCount
member.summary: Gets the number of transactions used by the service to analyze the input document.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.MultiLabelClassifyAction
member.summary: Configurations that allow callers to specify details about how to execute a Multi Label Classification action on a set of documents. This corresponds to a Multi Classification task in the Language service. For example, the target project and deployment names are required for a successful custom classification action.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.MultiLabelClassifyAction.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class which allows callers to specify details about how to execute a Multi Label Classification action on a set of documents. Sets the and properties.

member.summary: Gets the value of the property corresponding to the name of the target project

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.MultiLabelClassifyAction.DeploymentName
member.summary: Gets the value of the property corresponding to the name of the target deployment.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.MultiLabelClassifyAction.DisableServiceLogs
member.summary:
The default value of this property is 'false'. This means, the Language service logs your input text for 48 hours, solely to allow for troubleshooting issues. Setting this property to true, disables input logging and may limit our ability to investigate issues that occur.
Please see Cognitive Services Compliance and Privacy notes at for additional details, and Microsoft Responsible AI principles at .

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceOpinion
member.summary: A sentence opinion object contains assessments extracted from a sentence. It consists of both the target that these assessments are about, and the actual assessment themselves.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceOpinion.Target
member.summary:
Get the target in text, such as the attributes of products or services.
For example in "The food at Hotel Foo is good", "food" is a target of "Hotel Foo".

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceOpinion.Assessments
member.summary:
The list of assessments that are related to the target.
For example in "The food at Hotel Foo is good", "food" is a target of "Hotel Foo" and "good" is the assessment related to the target.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment
member.summary:
The predicted sentiment and other analysis like Opinion mining for each sentence in the corresponding document.
For more information regarding text sentiment, see .

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.Sentiment
member.summary: Gets the predicted sentiment for the analyzed sentence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.Text
member.summary: Gets the sentence text.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.ConfidenceScores
member.summary: Gets the sentiment confidence score (Softmax score) between 0 and 1, for each sentiment. Higher values signify higher confidence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.Opinions
member.summary: Gets the opinion of a sentence. This is only returned if is set to True.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.Offset
member.summary: Gets the starting position for the matching text in the sentence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SentenceSentiment.Length
member.summary: Gets the length the matching text in the sentence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SingleLabelClassifyOptions.DisableServiceLogs
member.summary:
The default value of this property is false. This means that the Language service logs your input text for 48 hours solely to allow for troubleshooting issues. Setting this property to true disables input logging and may limit our ability to investigate issues that occur.
Please see Cognitive Services Compliance and Privacy notes at for additional details, and Microsoft Responsible AI principles at .

member.summary: Optional display name for the operation.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment
member.summary:
Contains the related assessments, predicted sentiment, confidence scores and other information about a target of a product. A Target of a product/service is a key component of that product/service.
For example in "The food at Hotel Foo is good", "food" is a target of "Hotel Foo".

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment.Sentiment
member.summary: Gets the predicted sentiment for the analyzed target.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment.Text
member.summary:
Gets the target text.
A target of a product/service is a key component of that product/service.
For example in "The food at Hotel Foo is good", "food" is a target of "Hotel Foo".

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment.ConfidenceScores
member.summary: Gets the sentiment confidence score (Softmax score) between 0 and 1, for the target for 'positive' and 'negative' labels. Its score for 'neutral' will always be 0. Higher values signify higher confidence.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment.Offset
member.summary: Gets the starting position for the target text.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TargetSentiment.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the target text.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsClient.DetectLanguageAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Runs a predictive model to determine the language the passed-in document is written in, and returns the detected language as well as a score indicating the model's confidence that the inferred language is correct. Scores close to 1 indicate high certainty in the result.
For document length limits, maximum batch size, and supported text encoding, see .
member.param: Indicates the country of origin of the document to assist the model in predicting the language it is written in. If unspecified, this value will be set to the default country hint in in the request sent to the service. To remove this behavior, set to .
member.returns: A result containing the detected language or an error if the model could not analyze the document.
member.exception: Service returned a non-success status code.

member.exception: Service returned a non-success status code.

member.summary:
Runs a predictive model to determine the language the passed-in documents are written in, and returns, for each one, the detected language as well as a score indicating the model's confidence that the inferred language is correct. Scores close to 1 indicate high certainty in the result.
For document length limits, maximum batch size, and supported text encoding, see .
member.param: A collection of documents to analyze.

Indicates the country of origin of all of the documents to assist the model in predicting the language they are written in. If unspecified, this value will be set to the default country hint in in the request sent to the service. To remove this behavior, set to .
used to select the version of the predictive model to run, and whether statistics are returned in the response.
member.returns: A result containing the detected language or an error if the model could not analyze the documents.
member.exception: is only supported in service API version v3.1 and newer.
Service returned a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsClient.RecognizeEntitiesAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Runs a predictive model to identify a collection of named entities in the passed-in document, and categorize those entities into types such as person, location, or organization.
For more information on available categories, see .
For a list of languages supported by this operation, see .
For document length limits, maximum batch size, and supported text encoding, see .
member.param: The language that the document is written in. If unspecified, this value will be set to the default language in in the request sent to the service. If set to an empty string, the service will apply a model where the language is explicitly set to "None".
member.returns: A result containing the collection of entities identified in the document, as well as a score indicating the confidence that the entity correctly matches the identified substring.
member.exception: Service returned a non-success status code.

member.summary:
StartAnalyzeActionsAsync enables the application to execute multiple actions in a set of documents. It includes:
Entity Recognition (Named, Linked, and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) entities)
Key Phrases Extraction
Sentiment Analysis
Extractive Text Summarization
Custom Entity Recognition
Custom Single and Multi Label Classification
For document length limits, maximum batch size, and supported text encoding, see more information here.
member.remarks: This method is only available for , , and newer. See the service documentation for regional support of custom action features.
member.param: The list of documents to analyze.
The language that the document is written in.
The different to execute in the list of documents.
Sets the IncludeStatistcs property on the analyze action operation.
member.exception: This method is only supported in service API version v3.1 and newer; and the , , , and are only supported in service API version 2022-05-01 and newer.
Service returned a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsClient.StartSingleLabelClassify(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.SingleLabelClassifyOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Runs a predictive model to identify a classify each document with a single label in the passed-in documents.
For more information on available categories, see .
For a list of languages supported by this operation, see .
For document length limits, maximum batch size, and supported text encoding, see .
member.remarks: This method is only available for and newer.
member.param: The name of the project which owns the models being consumed.
The name of the deployment being consumed.

The language that all the documents are written in. If unspecified, this value will be set to the default language in in the request sent to the service. If set to an empty string, the service will apply a model where the language is explicitly set to "None".
used to select the version of the predictive model to run, and whether statistics are returned in the response.
member.returns: A result containing the collection of entities identified for each of the documents, as well as scores indicating the confidence that a given entity correctly matches the identified substring.
member.exception: Service returned a non-success status code.
This method is only supported in service API version 2022-05-01 and newer.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions
member.summary:
Options that allow callers to specify details about how the operation is run and what information is returned from it by the service.
For example, set model version, whether to include statistics, and more.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class which allows callers to specify details about how the operation is run. For example, set model version, whether to include statistics, and more.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions.IncludeStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that, if set to true, indicates that the service should return document and document batch statistics with the results of the operation. Returns data for batch document methods only.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions.ModelVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that, if set, indicates the version of the Language service model that will be used to generate the result. For supported model versions, see operation-specific documentation, for example: .

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions.DisableServiceLogs
member.summary:
The default value of this property is false except for methods like StartAnalyzeHealthcareEntities and RecognizePiiEntities. This means that the Language service logs your input text for 48 hours solely to allow for troubleshooting issues. Setting this property to true disables input logging and may limit our ability to investigate issues that occur.
Please see Cognitive Services Compliance and Privacy notes at for additional details, and Microsoft Responsible AI principles at .
member.remarks: This property only applies for , , and newer.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsRequestOptions.CheckSupported(Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsClientOptions.ServiceVersion)
member.summary: Checks that the specified supports all properties set within this model.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsResult
member.summary: Base type for results of Text Analytics operations corresponding to a document. If the operation is unsuccessful, the Id and Error properties will be populated, but not others.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsResult.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the document that generated the result.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsResult.Statistics
member.summary: Gets statistics about the document and how it was processed by the service. This property will have a value when IncludeStatistics is set to true in the client call.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsResult.Error
member.summary: Gets the error explaining why the operation failed on this document. This property will have a value only when the document cannot be processed.

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsResult.HasError
member.summary: Indicates that the document was not successfully processed and an error was returned for this document.

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsWarning

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsWarning.WarningCode

member.name: P:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextAnalyticsWarning.Message

member.name: T:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentInput
member.summary: An input representing an individual text document to be analyzed by the Language service predictive model for a given operation. The document contains the document's id, the full text of the document, and the language that the document is written in.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.TextDocumentInput.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.param: The id of the document represented by this instance. The id must be unique within the batch of documents analyzed in a given operation.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.Legacy.TextAnalyticsRestClient.AnalyzeStatusAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get analysis status and results.
member.param: (Optional) if set to true, response will contain request and document level statistics.
(Optional) Set the maximum number of results per task. When both $top and $skip are specified, $skip is applied first.
(Optional) Set the number of elements to offset in the response. When both $top and $skip are specified, $skip is applied first.
member.remarks: Get the status of an analysis job. A job may consist of one or more tasks. Once all tasks are completed, the job will transition to the completed state and results will be available for each task.

member.name: M:Azure.AI.TextAnalytics.Legacy.TextAnalyticsRestClient.AnalyzeStatus(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get analysis status and results.
member.param: (Optional) if set to true, response will contain request and document level statistics.
(Optional) Set the maximum number of results per task. When both $top and $skip are specified, $skip is applied first.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Used for diagnostic scope and exception creation. This is expected to be the instance created during the construction of your main client.
The long-running operation making use of this class. Passing "this" is expected.

The initial value of . Usually, long-running operation objects can be instantiated in two ways:
When calling a client's "Start<OperationName>" method, a service call is made to start the operation, and an instance is returned. In this case, the response received from this service call can be passed here.
When a user instantiates an directly using a public constructor, there's no previous service call. In this case, passing null is expected.
The type name of the long-running operation making use of this class. Used when creating diagnostic scopes. If left null, the type name will be inferred based on the parameter .
The attributes to use during diagnostic scope creation.
The fallback delay strategy when Retry-After header is not present. When it is present, the longer of the two delays will be used. Default is .

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. The maximum of the retry after value and the fallback is then used as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms", Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. The interval between calls is defined by the parameter , but it can change based on information returned from the server. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. In this case, the maximum value between the parameter and the retry-after header is chosen as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.
